title.native: 地球防衛企業ダイ・ガード

description:
Thirteen years after their sudden disappearance, an alien race known as the Heterodyne resurface without warning. To combat the Heterodyne, three office workers from the 21st Century Security Corporation operate Dai-Guard - a giant robot no longer regarded as an oversized paperweight. Unfortunately, Dai-Guard is somewhat obsolete and in disrepair. It's a tough job, but salarymen can also save the world.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

title.native: 地球防衛企業ダイ・ガード

node.description:
Kanno's earliest experiences with music came from attending church with her parents. She studied keyboard from a young age on both the piano in her home and the organ at her kindergarten. In elementary school, she began participating in composition contests, but in high school, Kanno began to take more of an interest in literature than in music.

She attended Waseda University, where she majored in literature, but she transcribed music for various student groups at Waseda in her free time. While in university, Koei, a Japanese video game company, asked her to compose the soundtrack to Nobunaga's Ambition. The game turned out to be a hit, and Kanno's music career was launched.

Kanno has also composed music for artists such as [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/), [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/) and [Kyouko Koizumi](https://anilist.co/staff/164646/). She is also a keyboardist, as well as the frontwoman for [Seatbelts](https://anilist.co/staff/193673/), who perform many of Kanno's compositions and soundtracks.

She has collaborated with directors [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/) and [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/) multiple times.

In addition to Japanese, she speaks a little English and some French.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).
Representative Director and President of animation studio [Signal.MD](https://anilist.co/studio/6101/SignalMD).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

Began his career at Ashi Productions. Leaving years later with [Nobuyoshi Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/115631/) and other Ashi staff to form [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1995.

During his time at Xebec, Ishihara would become one of the studio's most prolific and trusted animators, supervisors, and designers. He is best known for his adaptive designs for the [Rockman.EXE](https://anilist.co/anime/1710/) series. Other notable character design works include [Bakusou Kyoudai Let's & Go MAX](https://anilist.co/anime/2709/), [Dai-Guard](https://anilist.co/anime/1312/), [Daughters of Mnemosyne](https://anilist.co/anime/3342/), among others.

To this day he is well regarded by former Xebec staff. [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/) recalls how it was Ishihara who had personally recruited him and led to him joining Xebec. [Kiyotaka Oshiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/119806/) said that Ishihara had helped him establish connections at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) early in his career when Ishihara invited him to take part in the first [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/430/) film.

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/ozone_maru) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/users/15639)

Publishes explicit doujinshi under the name "Marumiya."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oichanmusi) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/oichanmusi.bsky.social) | [Website](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/team/mizushima-seiji/)

After graduating from Tokyo Designers' Gakuin College, Mizushima joined [Tokyo Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/899/). While doing photography work at the beginning of his career he studied under director of photography [Masahiro Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/174419/). He later went to work for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant, aiming to become a full-fledged director.

Mizushima debuted as an episode director in 1993 on [Kouryuu Densetsu Villgust](https://anilist.co/anime/2049/), aiding the director of the OVA [Katsuhiko Nishijima](https://anilist.co/staff/103059/). In 1998, he made his proper directorial debut with [Generator Gawl](https://anilist.co/anime/1022/). He has since gone on to direct numerous shows, among which [Shaman King](https://anilist.co/anime/154/), [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/) and [Oh! Edo Rocket](https://anilist.co/anime/2152/).

He often cites [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/) as an anime director that he respects.

Began his career at Ashi Productions. Leaving years later with [Nobuyoshi Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/115631/) and other Ashi staff to form [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1995.

During his time at Xebec, Ishihara would become one of the studio's most prolific and trusted animators, supervisors, and designers. He is best known for his adaptive designs for the [Rockman.EXE](https://anilist.co/anime/1710/) series. Other notable character design works include [Bakusou Kyoudai Let's & Go MAX](https://anilist.co/anime/2709/), [Dai-Guard](https://anilist.co/anime/1312/), [Daughters of Mnemosyne](https://anilist.co/anime/3342/), among others.

To this day he is well regarded by former Xebec staff. [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/) recalls how it was Ishihara who had personally recruited him and led to him joining Xebec. [Kiyotaka Oshiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/119806/) said that Ishihara had helped him establish connections at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) early in his career when Ishihara invited him to take part in the first [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/430/) film.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).
He was a scriptwriter and animation producer previously working for [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Former producer and one of the founders of studio [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oichanmusi) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/oichanmusi.bsky.social) | [Website](https://hifumi-inc.co.jp/team/mizushima-seiji/)

Edo Rocket](https://anilist.co/anime/2152/).
